00043 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ  (1<<KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER)

00055 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00056 
00057     /* Kernel mode side */
00058 
00059     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or
00060                                    &user->thread.esp).
00061                                    DONT MOVE THIS MEMBER,
00062                                    switch_to depends on it. */
00063 
00064     struct ia64_fpreg fpuenv[96]; /* FIXME FPU: check if alignment constraints
00065                                      are needed. */
00066     
00067     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00068     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00069     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00070 
00071     /* User mode side */
00072 
00073     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00074     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00075 
00076     struct ia64_fpreg *fpup;
00077 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00078 
00079 } xnarchtcb_t;

00084     unsigned trap;

00086 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;

00088 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((fi)->trap)
00089 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->ia64.isr)
00090 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->ia64.regs->cr_iip)
00091 /* fault is caused by use FPU while FPU disabled. */
00092 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi) ((fi)->trap == ADEOS_FPDIS_TRAP)
00093 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00094    Linux stack context. */
00095 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->trap == ADEOS_PF_TRAP)
00096 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00097                                  (fi)->trap != ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP)

00102 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00103 
00104 {
00105     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00106         return vmalloc(bytes);
00107 
00108     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00109 }
00110 
00111 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00112 
00113 {
00114     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00115         vfree(chunk);
00116     else
00117         kfree(chunk);
00118 }

00120 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00121 
00122 {
00123 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00124     adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_HOST_TIMER_IRQ, cpu_online_map);
00125 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00126     adeos_trigger_irq(RTHAL_HOST_TIMER_IRQ);
00127 #endif
00128 }

00136 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00137                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00138 {
00139     int err = rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);
00140     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00141     long long delta;
00142 
00143     if (err)
00144         return err;
00145 
00146     adeos_load_cpuid();
00147     delta = __adeos_itm_next[cpuid] - ia64_get_itc();
00148     
00149     return delta < 0LL ? 0LL : xnarch_tsc_to_ns(delta);
00150 }
00151 
00152 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00153 
00154 {
00155     struct task_struct *fpu_owner
00156         = (struct task_struct *)ia64_get_kr(IA64_KR_FPU_OWNER);
00157     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00158 
00159     adeos_load_cpuid();
00160 
00161     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00162     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00163     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00164     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00165     rootcb->fpup = fpu_owner ? fpu_owner->thread.fph : NULL;
00166 }
00167 
00168 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00169 {
00170     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00171 }
00172 
00173 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00174                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00175 {
00176     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00177     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00178 
00179     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00180 
00181     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00182         {
00183         /* We are switching to a user task different from the last
00184            preempted or running user task, so that we can use the
00185            Linux context switch routine. */
00186         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00187         struct task_struct *last;
00188 
00189         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00190 
00191         if (!inproc->mm)
00192             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00193 
00194         __switch_to(outproc, inproc, last);
00195         }
00196     else
00197         {
00198         /* Use our own light switch routine. */
00199         unsigned long gp;
00200 
00201         ia64_stop();
00202         gp = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_GP);
00203         ia64_stop();
00204         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb,in_tcb);
00205         ia64_stop();
00206         ia64_setreg(_IA64_REG_GP, gp);
00207         ia64_stop();
00208 
00209         /* fph will be enabled by xnarch_restore_fpu if needed, and
00210            returns the root thread in its usual mode. */
00211         ia64_fph_disable();
00212         }
00213 }
00214 
00215 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00216                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00217 {
00218     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00219 }
00220 
00221 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00222 
00223 {
00224     /* Empty */
00225 }
00226 
00227 #define fph2task(faddr)                                 \
00228     ((struct task_struct *)((char *) (faddr) -          \
00229                             (size_t) &((struct task_struct *) 0)->thread.fph[0]))
00230 
00231 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) ((task)->thread.flags & IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID)
00232 
00233 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00234 
00235 {
00236     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00237     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00238        task. */
00239     ia64_fph_enable();
00240     __ia64_init_fpu();
00241     /* The mfh bit is automatically armed, since the init_fpu routine
00242        modifies the FPH registers. */
00243 
00244     if(task)
00245         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: setting the mfh bit in saved
00246           registers, xnarch_save_fpu will finish the work. Since tcb is the tcb
00247           of a shadow, no need to check: task == fph2task(tcb->fpup). */
00248         ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(task))->mfh = 1;
00249 }
00250 
00251 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00252 {
00253     unsigned long lpsr = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_PSR);
00254     struct ia64_psr *current_psr = (struct ia64_psr *) &lpsr;
00255     
00256     if (current_psr->mfh)
00257         {
00258         if(tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00259             {
00260             struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00261             struct ia64_psr *psr = ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(linux_fpu_owner));
00262 
00263             /* Keep the FPU save zone in sync with what Linux expects. */
00264             psr->mfh = 0;
00265             linux_fpu_owner->thread.flags |= IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID;
00266             }
00267 
00268         ia64_fph_enable();
00269         __ia64_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00270         ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00271         ia64_srlz_d();
00272         }
00273 }
00274 
00275 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00276 
00277 {
00278     struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner;
00279     int need_disabled_fph;
00280 
00281     if (tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00282         {
00283         linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00284 
00285         if(!xnarch_fpu_init_p(linux_fpu_owner))
00286             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00287 
00288         /* Disable fph, if we are not switching back to the task which
00289            owns the FPU. */
00290         need_disabled_fph = linux_fpu_owner != tcb->user_task;
00291         }
00292     else
00293         need_disabled_fph = 0;
00294 
00295     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00296        user-space or kernel thread. */
00297     ia64_fph_enable();
00298     __ia64_load_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00299     ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00300     ia64_srlz_d();
00301 
00302     if(need_disabled_fph)
00303         ia64_fph_disable();
00304 }
00305 
00306 
00307 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00308 {
00309     ia64_fph_enable();
00310 }
00311 
00312 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00313                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00314                                          const char *name)
00315 {
00316     tcb->user_task = current;
00317     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00318     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00319     tcb->fpup = current->thread.fph;
00320 }
00321 
00322 static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (struct xnthread *self,
00323                                       int imask,
00324                                       void(*entry)(void *),
00325                                       void *cookie)
00326 {
00327     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do ia64_fpu_enable() if needed. */
00328     ia64_fph_disable();
00329     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00330     rthal_hw_enable();
00331     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00332     entry(cookie);
00333     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00334 }
00335 
00336 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00337                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00338                                        void *cookie,
00339                                        int imask,
00340                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00341                                        char *name)
00342 {
00343     unsigned long rbs,bspstore,child_stack,child_rbs,rbs_size;
00344     unsigned long stackbase = (unsigned long) tcb->stackbase;
00345     struct switch_stack *swstack;    
00346 
00347     tcb->esp = 0;
00348     
00349     /* the stack should have already been allocated */   
00350     rthal_prepare_stack(stackbase+KERNEL_STACK_SIZE);
00351 
00352     /* The value of esp is used as a marker to indicate whether we are
00353        initializing a new task or we are back from the context switch. */
00354 
00355     if (tcb->esp != 0)
00356         xnarch_thread_trampoline(thread, imask, entry, cookie);
00357 
00358     child_stack = stackbase + KERNEL_STACK_SIZE - IA64_SWITCH_STACK_SIZE;
00359     tcb->esp = child_stack;
00360     swstack = (struct switch_stack *)child_stack;
00361     bspstore = swstack->ar_bspstore;
00362 
00363     rbs = (ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_SP) & ~(KERNEL_STACK_SIZE-1)) + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00364     child_rbs = stackbase + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00365     rbs_size = bspstore - rbs;
00366 
00367     memcpy((void *)child_rbs,(void *)rbs,rbs_size);
00368     swstack->ar_bspstore = child_rbs + rbs_size;
00369     tcb->esp -= 16 ;    /* Provide for the (bloody) scratch area... */
00370 }

00374 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00375 
00376     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00377 }
00378 
00379 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00380 
00381 {
00382     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00383                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00384                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00385                                      NULL,
00386                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00387 }
00388 
00389 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00390 
00391 {
00392     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00393                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00394                                      NULL,
00395                                      NULL,
00396                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00397 }
00398 
00399 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00400 
00401 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00402 {
00403     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00404 }
00405 
00406 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00407 
00408 {
00409     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00410     cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00411     unsigned long flags;
00412     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00413 
00414     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00415 
00416     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00417        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00418        context. */
00419     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00420                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00421 
00422     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00423     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00424     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00425     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00426 
00427     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00428         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00429     
00430     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00431                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00432 }
00433 
00434 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00435

00437 
00438 {
00439     return 0;
00440 }

00448 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00449 
00450 {
00451     return 0;
00452 }

00454 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00455 
00456 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00457 
00458 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00459 
00460 {
00461 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00462     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00463        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00464     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00465 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00466 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00467     xnshadow_release_events();
00468 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00469     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00470     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00471     schedule_timeout(50);
00472     xnarch_release_ipi();
00473 }
00474 
00475 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00476 
00477 {
00478     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00479 
00480     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00481         {
00482         spl_t s;
00483         splsync(s);
00484         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00485         splexit(s);
00486         return 1;
00487         }
00488 
00489     return 0;
00490 }
00491 
00492 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00493 
00494 {
00495 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00496     xnshadow_grab_events();
00497 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00498 }

00500 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00504 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00505 {
00506     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00507     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00508     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00509     tcb->fpup = tcb->fpuenv;
00510     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00511 }
00512 
00513 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00514 
00515 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00516 
00517 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00518                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00519                                            const char *name)
00520 {
00521     struct task_struct *task = current;
00522 
00523     tcb->user_task = task;
00524     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00525     tcb->esp = 0;
00526     tcb->espp = &task->thread.ksp;
00527     tcb->fpup = task->thread.fph;
00528 }
00529 
00530 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00531 
00532 {
00533     unsigned irq;
00534 
00535     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00536         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00537                              handler,
00538                              NULL,
00539                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00540 }
00541 
00542 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00543 
00544 {
00545     unsigned irq;
00546 
00547     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00548         {
00549         unsigned vector = __ia64_local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00550 
00551         switch (vector)
00552             {
00553 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00554             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00555             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00556             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00557 
00558                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00559                 continue;
00560 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00561 
00562             default:
00563 
00564                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00565             }
00566         }
00567 }
00568 
00569 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00570 
00571 {
00572     unsigned irq;
00573 
00574     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00575         {
00576         unsigned vector = local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00577 
00578         switch (vector)
00579             {
00580 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00581             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00582             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00583             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00584 
00585                 continue;
00586 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00587 
00588             default:
00589 
00590                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00591             }
00592         }
00593 }
00594 
00595 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00633 
00634 typedef struct xnarch_stack {
00635     struct xnarch_stack *next;
00636 } xnarch_stack_t;
00637 
00638 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00639 static xnlock_t xnarch_stacks_lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00640 #endif
00641 static atomic_counter_t xnarch_allocated_stacks;
00642 
00643 static xnarch_stack_t xnarch_free_stacks_q;
00644 static atomic_counter_t xnarch_free_stacks_count;
00645 
00646 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00647 
00648 {
00649     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00650 
00651     fltinfo.trap = evinfo->event;
00652     fltinfo.ia64 = *(ia64trapinfo_t *)evinfo->evdata;
00653 
00654     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00655 }
00656 
00657 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00658 
00659 {
00660 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00661     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00662 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00663     /* Compute the time needed to program the ITM in aperiodic
00664        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. */
00665     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00666 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00667 }
00668 
00669 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00670 
00671 {
00672     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00673 
00674     if (!nktimerlat)
00675         return -ENODEV;
00676 
00677     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00678 
00679     return 0;
00680 }
00681 
00682 static inline void stacksq_push(xnarch_stack_t *q, xnarch_stack_t *stack)
00683 {
00684     stack->next = q->next;
00685     q->next = stack;
00686 }
00687 
00688 static inline xnarch_stack_t *stacksq_pop(xnarch_stack_t *q)
00689 {
00690     xnarch_stack_t *stack = q->next;
00691 
00692     if(stack)
00693         q->next = stack->next;
00694 
00695     return stack;
00696 }
00697 
00698 void *xnarch_alloc_stack(unsigned long stacksize)
00699 
00700 {
00701     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00702     spl_t s;
00703 
00704     if (stacksize > KERNEL_STACK_SIZE)
00705         return NULL;
00706 
00707     if (adp_current == adp_root &&
00708         atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) <= CONFIG_RTAI_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00709         {
00710         stack = (xnarch_stack_t *)
00711             __get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00712 
00713         if(stack)
00714             atomic_inc(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00715 
00716         return stack;
00717         }
00718 
00719     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00720     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00721     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00722 
00723     if (stack)
00724         atomic_dec(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00725 
00726     return stack;
00727 }
00728 
00729 void xnarch_free_stack(void *block)
00730 
00731 {
00732     xnarch_stack_t *stack = (xnarch_stack_t *) block;
00733     spl_t s;
00734 
00735     if (!stack)
00736         return;
00737 
00738     if (adp_current == adp_root
00739         && atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) > CONFIG_RTAI_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00740         {
00741         atomic_dec(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00742             
00743         free_pages((unsigned long) block,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00744 
00745         return ;
00746         }
00747 
00748     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00749     stacksq_push(&xnarch_free_stacks_q, stack);
00750     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00751     
00752     atomic_inc(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00753 }
00754 
00755 static int xnarch_stack_pool_init(void)
00756 
00757 {
00758     while (atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) < CONFIG_RTAI_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00759         {
00760         void *stack = xnarch_alloc_stack(KERNEL_STACK_SIZE);
00761 
00762         if(!stack)
00763             return -ENOMEM;
00764 
00765         xnarch_free_stack(stack);
00766         }
00767 
00768     return 0;
00769 }
00770 
00771 static void xnarch_stack_pool_destroy(void)
00772 
00773 {
00774     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00775 
00776     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00777 
00778     while (stack)
00779         {
00780         free_pages((unsigned long) stack, KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00781         stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00782 
00783         if(atomic_dec_and_test(&xnarch_allocated_stacks))
00784             break;
00785         }
00786 
00787     if (atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks) != 0)
00788         xnarch_logwarn("leaked %u kernel threads stacks.\n",
00789                        atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks));
00790 
00791     if (xnarch_free_stacks_q.next)
00792         xnarch_logwarn("kernel threads stacks pool corrupted.\n");
00793 }
00794 
00795 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00796 
00797 {
00798     int err;
00799 
00800 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00801     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00802        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00803     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00804 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00805 
00806     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00807 
00808     if (err)
00809         return err;
00810 
00811     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00812 
00813     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00814         return -ENOSYS;
00815 
00816     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00817                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00818                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00819                               NULL,
00820                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00821 
00822     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00823 
00824 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00825     err = xnshadow_mount();
00826 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00827 
00828     if (err)
00829         goto release_trap;
00830 
00831     err = xnarch_stack_pool_init();
00832 
00833     if (!err)
00834         return 0;
00835 
00836 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00837     xnshadow_cleanup();
00838 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00839 
00840  release_trap:
00841     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00842     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00843 
00844     return err;
00845 }
00846 
00847 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00848 
00849 {
00850 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00851     xnshadow_cleanup();
00852 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00853     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00854     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00855     xnarch_stack_pool_destroy();
00856 }
00857 
00858 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00859 
00860 #ifdef __cplusplus
00861 }
00862 #endif
00863 
00864 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00865 
00866 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00867 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
00868 
00869 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00870 
00871 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_IA64_SYSTEM_H */
